title: Data Centers Are Driving a US Gas Boom
summary: Gas projects in the US pipeline explicitly linked to data centers increased by almost 25 times over the past two years, according to new research from Global Energy Monitor.

title: Teenage girl who lived in Italy 12,000 years ago had a rare form of dwarfism, DNA study shows
summary: In 1963, researchers unearthed two Stone Age skeletons that were buried in an embraced position in a cave in Italy. Now, DNA testing has revealed that one of them had a rare genetic condition.

title: Complex building blocks of life can form on space dust — offering new clues to the origins of life
summary: The complex building blocks of life can form spontaneously in space, a new lab experiment shows.

title: 430,000-year-old wooden handheld tools from Greece are the oldest on record — and they predate modern humans
summary: Archaeologists have found the oldest-known surviving examples of handheld wooden tools.

title: The Doomsday Clock Is Now 85 Seconds to Midnight. Here’s What That Means
summary: Catastrophic risks are increasing, cooperation is declining, and swift action is needed from global leaders to correct course.

title: Giant 'metal cloud' spotted in nearby star system could be hiding a second alien sun
summary: Astronomers suspect that a massive metallic cloud swirling in a nearby star system could be hiding a giant planet or dwarf star from view, after it drastically dimmed a sun-like star for around nine months.

title: NASA is preparing for simulated launch of Artemis II mega moon rocket — and it could happen as early as Saturday
summary: NASA has announced it will fuel the Artemis II rocket as part of a simulated launch that will take place as early as Saturday (Jan. 31).

title: See February's full Snow Moon rise this weekend next to a glittering star cluster
summary: February's full "Snow Moon" will be at its fullest on Sunday, Feb. 1, and will be best seen at moonrise. It will appear just beneath the Beehive Cluster, one of the closest star clusters to the solar system.

title: 20% Squarespace Promo Codes | February 2026
summary: Get 20% off your next website, 10% off with exclusive Squarespace discount code, 50% off plans, and more top coupons from WIRED.

title: Radiation-tolerant atomic-layer-scale RF system for spaceborne communication
summary:
Nature, Published online: 28 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-10027-9

Using a wafer-scale monolayer 2D MoS2 process instead of conventional silicon-based devices to manufacture components of spaceborne communication systems …
body: Nature, Published online: 28 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-10027-9 Using a wafer-scale monolayer 2D MoS2 process instead of conventional silicon-based devices to manufacture components of spaceborne communication systems demonstrates radiation tolerance, low bit error rate and long-term stability, even under much harsher radiation environments.

title: Optofluidic three-dimensional microfabrication and nanofabrication
summary:
Nature, Published online: 28 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-10033-x

A strategy compatible with a broad range of materials by precisely manipulating optofluidic interactions within a confined 3D space to control the assembl…
body: Nature, Published online: 28 January 2026; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-10033-x A strategy compatible with a broad range of materials by precisely manipulating optofluidic interactions within a confined 3D space to control the assembly of colloidal microparticles/nanoparticles is demonstrated, enabling the precise manufacture of complex microstructures/nanostructures.

title: Wikipedia is needed now more than ever, 25 years on
summary:
Nature, Published online: 28 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00074-1

The online encyclopedia is an antidote to an increasingly poisoned information ecosystem. Researchers should help to nourish it.
body: Nature, Published online: 28 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00074-1 The online encyclopedia is an antidote to an increasingly poisoned information ecosystem. Researchers should help to nourish it.

title: 160,000-year-old sophisticated stone tools discovered in China may not have been made by Homo sapiens
summary: Archaeologists have found the oldest known evidence of hafted tools in East Asia, and they challenge a previously held assumption about stone tool use.

title: Rock climbers in Italy accidentally discovered evidence of an 80 million-year-old sea turtle stampede
summary: Scientists say grooves on a rock face overlooking the Adriatic Sea may have been made by sea turtles fleeing an earthquake.

title: African science needs to cut reliance on foreign donors
summary:
Nature, Published online: 27 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00263-y

African science needs to cut reliance on foreign donors
body: Nature, Published online: 27 January 2026; doi:10.1038/d41586-026-00263-y African science needs to cut reliance on foreign donors

title: دمية "الحصان الباكي" تحصد الإعجاب في الصين
summary: في مدينة ييوو للتجارة الدولية، أكبر سوق للجملة في الصين، يتزاحم الزبائن في متجر صغير بحثا عن سلعة رائجة بشكل غير متوقع قبل حلول السنة القمرية الجديدة.

title: How to see 2 total solar eclipses in the next 2 years — including the 'eclipse of the century'
summary: After a two-year gap, there will be two total solar eclipses within 12 months of each other, on Aug. 12, 2026, and Aug. 2, 2027.

title: A drying climate is making East Africa pull apart faster
summary: A switch from a humid to a dry climate has led the Eastern African Rift Zone to pull apart more freely, new research finds.

title: James Webb telescope peers into 'Eye of God' and finds clues to life's origins — Space photo of the week
summary: A spectacular new image from the James Webb Space Telescope reveals intricate structures inside the Helix Nebula, where a dying sunlike star is enriching the galaxy with the elements needed for life.

title: Why does the moon look larger when it's on the horizon?
summary: The moon looks enormous when it's near the horizon — why is that?

title: 2,500 years ago, people in Bulgaria ate dog meat at feasts and as a delicacy, archaeological study finds
summary: A study of dog bones across several Iron Age sites in Bulgaria has shown that people ate dog meat.

title: 480,000-year-old ax sharpener is the oldest known elephant bone tool ever discovered in Europe
summary: The "very rare" find provides an extraordinary glimpse into the ingenuity of early human relatives who lived around half a million years ago.

title: Astronomers discover a gigantic, wobbling black hole jet that 'changes the way we think about the galaxy'
summary: Combining observations from several powerful telescopes, astronomers have detected a gargantuan, 'wobbling' black hole outburst that's as wide as an entire galaxy.

title: Some of the oldest harpoons ever found reveal Indigenous people in Brazil were hunting whales 5,000 years ago
summary: The origins of whaling are highly debated. Now, some of the earliest signs of active whale hunting have appeared somewhere unexpected: southern Brazil.

title: 'A real revolution': The James Webb telescope is upending our understanding of the biggest, oldest black holes in the universe
summary: For years, the James Webb Space Telescope has been spotting enormous black holes in the early universe that defy all expectations. Now, astronomers are finally deciphering the origins of these cosmic behemoths.

title: Chocolate Hills: The color-changing mounds in the Philippines that inspired legends of mud-slinging giants
summary: The Chocolate Hills are 1,776 mounds on Bohol Island in the Philippines where grassy cover turns brown during the dry season.

title: An ocean the size of the Arctic once covered half of Mars, new images hint
summary: Mars may have been a "blue planet" with an ocean the size of today's Arctic Ocean, a new study suggests.

title: سباق مع الزمن.. عشرات طُمروا تحت "جبل نفايات" في الفلبين
summary: يواصل عناصر الإنقاذ، السبت، مستخدمين الجرافات عمليات البحث عن ناجين بين أكوام القمامة عقب انهيار مكب نفايات في وسط الفلبين، مما أدى إلى دفن عشرات من عمال النظافة ومقتل ستة منهم على الأقل.

title: رهان على مصير مادورو.. شخص مجهول عرف قبل الجميع
summary: حقق مقامر أرباحا تقارب نصف مليون دولار من رهانٍ على اعتقال الرئيس الفنزويلي نيكولاس مادورو، قبل الإعلان الرسمي عن العملية، ما أثار تساؤلات حول احتمال استفادة جهات من معلومات داخلية تتعلق بالتحرك الأميركي.
